scenes.title: Reynolds Foundations
scenes.narration_summary: Introduce Reynolds number as the key to fluid dynamics, but pivot to how climate models struggle with its implications across scales—setting up the critique of current modeling approaches.

scenes.title: Predictability Breakdown
scenes.narration_summary: Show how climate models' predictability weakens non-uniformly with Re, exposing their inability to handle transitional regimes where intermittency creates forecast cliffs—revealing a core weakness in spatial-temporal resolution.

scenes.title: Viscosity Paradox Exposed
scenes.narration_summary: Reveal the paradox: climate models require viscosity amplification that far exceeds physical justification, masking weaknesses in representing turbulent energy cascades and spatially coherent forcing.

scenes.title: Ghost Scale Weakness Diagnostic
scenes.narration_summary: Derive the ghost scale as a direct measure of model weakness: when L_implied exceeds domain size, it proves the model artificially suppresses processes it can't represent—exposing gaps in physics coverage at continental to planetary scales.

scenes.title: Implications for Model Reform
scenes.narration_summary: Demonstrate how this weakness can be quantified and addressed: compare viscosity in standard vs. extended models to test proposed fixes (e.g., ionospheric coupling), transforming climate modeling from empirical tuning to evidence-based diagnostics.
